alert.note: Alert for Inland Georgetown; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 7:50PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Georgetown and central Williamsburg Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 750 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bonneau, or 11 miles northeast of Moncks Corner, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Andrews, Trio, Warsaw, Earle, Morrisville, Gourdin, Salters and Lane. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
